Others: The Celtics won their second straight game against the Hornets on Saturday night with a comfortable 113-103 win at the Spectrum Center in Charlotte.
Jayson Tatum led the way for Boston with 29 points and 7 rebounds, doing most of his advantage at the free throw line where he went 14-of-17 from the stripe.
Payton Pritchard added six 3s off the bench while Luke Kornet (19 points, 6/6 FG), added a big boost in second straight spot start in place of an injured Jaylen Brown (sore hip).
LaMelo Ball had a game-high 37 points for the Hornets in the loss.
The Celtics improved to 6-1 with the victory and are now 2-1 on their four-game road trip.
Charlotte fell to 2-4 under Charles Lee after being swept in the weekend series.
